item.title: Training an embedding model
item.description:
Hi,

Based on my previous post, I need to write a correction. I was wrong. Using embeddings from pre-trained models is not a good idea, since the training objective is different. As an alternative, I will train an embedding model with contrastive learning. Please look at my notebook for more details and code

The reason why you should not use embeddings from pre-trained models is the anisotropy problem. The paper How Contextual are Contextualized Word Representations? from Ethayarajh et al. 2019 shows that the embeddings are clustered in a narrow cone of the vector space, making them almost useless for differentiation. So, if you calculate the cosine similarity between two completely different sentences, the result will be around 0.80.
